definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
to be unable to hold back
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
lit. paper can't wrap fire; fig. the truth will out
to be unable to bear or support
to be unable to repress sth/to be unable to contain oneself
not up to it/cannot stand the test
one who is not prepared to risk his child will never catch the wolf (proverb)/(fig.) one who is unwilling to take risks will not achieve great things
pinyin: she3 bu4 de5 hai2 zi5 tao4 bu4 zhu4 lang2

definition: (coll.) unable to withstand/cannot bear/can't stand it/no match for

sentences.english: Even if not to stay, so grand luxury Memorial also to be a trip.
sentences.chinese: 即使留不住，如此隆重奢华的祭奠也算不虚此行吧。

sentences.english: Where Beauty cannot keep her lustrous eyes.
sentences.chinese: 美丽留不住她明眸的光泽。

sentences.english: Ink to write that, should hide the facts written in blood.
sentences.chinese: 墨写的谎说，决掩不住血写的事实。

sentences.english: Retain the most memorable kiss, kissing the man failed to keep.
sentences.chinese: 留住了最刻骨铭心的吻，留不住接吻的那个人。

sentences.english: The wings of a crow can never cover up the sun.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸦的翅膀遮不住太阳。

sentences.english: It was incredible. They reached the shore and were shivering and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 刚一上岸，他俩显得相当紧张，并且止不住的发抖。

sentences.english: I couldn’t resist rolling down the window. As soon as I did, I heard waves crashing along the shoreline.
sentences.chinese: 我忍不住摇下车窗，立即听到了波涛冲刷海岸的声音。

sentences.english: Janie finally cannot resist speaking up, scolding the men.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮最后忍不住，大声责骂那些男人。

sentences.english: And they prevailed not, neither was their place found any more in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 但牠们敌不住，在天上遂再也没有牠们的地方了。

sentences.english: After a while, Pao-yu could wait no longer, so he stepped forward and removed the veil.
sentences.chinese: 又过了一会，宝玉实在按捺不住，上前揭了盖头。

sentences.english: I couldn't resist asking him whether he was dying to eat some pork with fermented mustard greens.
sentences.chinese: 我忍不住问他会不会很想吃梅干扣肉？

sentences.english: Not being able to stand his ingratiation , I helplessly agreed to his request.
sentences.chinese: 嚅嗫我经不住他的死缠硬泡，无奈地答应了他的请求。

sentences.english: His position doesn't stand up to detailed examination.
sentences.chinese: 他的立场经不住严格检查。

sentences.english: Sherry couldn't keep from crying when she heard the terrible news.
sentences.chinese: 雪丽听到这个坏消息的时候，忍不住哭了出来。

sentences.english: He could not restrain himself from shouting aloud.
sentences.chinese: 他克制不住自己要大声喊叫。

sentences.english: The small boat could not stem the rushing tide.
sentences.chinese: 这艘小船顶不住汹涌奔腾的潮水。

definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
no thanks (used to politely but informally decline)
to be unable to hold back
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to be not less than (a certain quantity, amount etc)
won't do/be out of the question/be no good/not work/not be capable
to be unable to repress sth/to be unable to contain oneself
